pages.text: Dracoraptor hanigani comes from the Lower Jurassic, with fossils being found in the Blue Lias Formation, Wales (United Kingdom). It is a medium sized coelophysoid, growing up to 2 m in the length, with a max size estimate of 3 m. It is earliest known Jurassic dinosaur, and its not only the first known dinosaur from Jurassic Wales, but also the most complete non-avian therapod from Wales.

The generic name derives from the Latin words 'Draco', to mean 'dragon'; and 'raptor', to mean 'thief'. The specific name derives from the Latinised surnames of Nick and Rob Hanigan, the discoverers of the fossil specimens.
